heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

storm.status: No storm activity at the moment.  The previous storm occurred on 28 September 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The maximum temperature difference seen is 26.7°C, observed on 29 April 2025 when the temperature fell to 0.4°C but also managed to reach 27.1°C on the same day.

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 6 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (188°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the feels like temperature (down 5.0°C) and outside temperature (down 4.7°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 7%).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 566 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in feels like temperature (up 48.6°C), dew point temperature (up 45.1°C), outside temperature (up 49.3°C), and cloud levels (up 537 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 566.2m lower than yesterday, 536.9m lower than the past week, 533.6m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 789m minimum and 3200m maximum, with an average of 1210.8m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1747.6m and 1744.4m.
cloud levels.summary: Cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; prepare for cold, chilly weather ahead. Also, low humidity will be noticeable and winds will be practically absent. Drizzle or light rain possible, cloud cover will be variable, overcast at times, and it’s dark. Little change in the weather.

washing.phrase: The current temperature is too low (6.6°C) for optimal drying conditions.  Any drying will take longer.
